column2: Interactively Exploring a Machine Translation Model

column2: Steve DeNeefe, Kevin Knight, and Hayward H. Chan

column2: Abstract
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-larger column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-abstract headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: This paper describes a method of in-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: teractively visualizing and directing the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: process of translating a sentence. The
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: method allows a user to explore a model
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of syntax-based statistical machine trans-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lation (MT), to understand the model’s
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strengths and weaknesses, and to compare
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it to other MT systems. Using this visual-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ization method, we can find and address
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: conceptual and practical problems in an
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: MT system. In our demonstration at ACL,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: new users of our tool will drive a syntax-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: based decoder for themselves.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: There are many new approaches to statistical ma-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: chine translation, and more ideas are being sug-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gested all the time. However, it is difficult to deter-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mine how well a model will actually perform. Ex-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: perienced researchers have been surprised by the ca-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pability of unintuitive word-for-word models; at the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: same time, seemingly capable models often have se-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rious hidden problems — intuition is no substitute
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for experimentation. With translation ideas growing
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: more complex, capturing aspects of linguistic struc-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ture in different ways, it becomes difficult to try out
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a new idea without a large-scale software develop-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ment effort.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Anyone who builds a full-scale, trainable trans-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: lation system using syntactic information faces this
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: problem. We know that syntactic models often do
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: not fit the data. For example, the syntactic sys-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tem described in Yamada and Knight (2001) can-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: not translate n-to-m-word phrases and does not al-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: low for multi-level syntactic transformations; both
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: phenomena are frequently observed in real data. In
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: building a new syntax-based MT system which ad-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dresses these flaws, we wanted to find problems in
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: our framework as early as possible. So we decided
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to create a tool that could help us answer questions
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: like:
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1. Does our framework allow good translations
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: for real data, and if not, where does it get stuck?
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2. How does our framework compare to exist-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent hanged-line line-double-space line-space itemization tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing state-of-the-art phrase-based statistical MT
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower

column2: systems such as Och and Ney (2004)?
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The result is DerivTool, an interactive translation
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: visualization tool. It allows a user to build up a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: translation from one language to another, step by
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: step, presenting the user with the myriad of choices
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: available to the decoder at each point in the pro-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cess. DerivTool simplifies the user’s experience of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: exploring these choices by presenting only the de-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cisions relevant to the context in which the user is
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: working, and allowing the user to search for choices
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that fit a particular set of conditions. Some previ-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ous tools have allowed the user to visualize word
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: alignment information (Callison-Burch et al., 2004;
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-semicolon

column2: Smith and Jahr, 2000), but there has been no cor-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: responding deep effort into visualizing the decoding
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: experience itself. Other tools use visualization to aid
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the user in manually developing a grammar (Copes-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: take and Flickinger, 2000), while our tool visualizes
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Proceedings of the ACL Interactive Poster and Demonstration Sessions,
column3: page=0 xpos=2 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: pages 97–100, Ann Arbor, June 2005.  2005 c Association for Computational Linguistics
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest hanged-line longer-tail year headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: __Table 1__
column3: page=1 xpos=-1 ypos=-3 single-column centered box page-top table-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 1: By applying applying four rules, a Chinese verb phrase is translated to English.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: the translation process itself, using rules from very
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: large, automatically learned rule sets. DerivTool can
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be adapted to visualize other syntax-based MT mod-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: els, other tree-to-tree or tree-to-string MT models, or
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: models for paraphrasing.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 Translation Framework
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: It is useful at this point to give a brief descrip-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of the syntax-based framework that we work
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with, which is based on translating Chinese sen-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tences into English syntax trees. Galley et al. (2004)
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: describe how to learn hundreds of millions of tree-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: transformation rules from a parsed, aligned Chi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nese/English corpus, and Galley et al. (submitted)
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: describe probability estimators for those rules. We
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: decode a new Chinese sentence with a method simi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lar to parsing, where we apply learned rules to build
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: up a complete English tree hypothesis from the Chi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nese string.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The rule extractor learns rules for many situations.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: Some are simple phrase-to-phrase rules such as:
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-capital tailchar-colon above-line-space

column2: NPB(DT(the) NNS(police)) ↔ ´ 0
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: This rule should be read as follows: replace the Chi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: nese word ´ 0 with the noun phrase “the police”.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Others rules can take existing tree fragments and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: build upon them. For example, the rule
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: S(x0:NP-C x1:VP x2:.) ↔ x0 x1 x2
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: takes three parts of a sentence, a noun phrase (x0),
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: a verb phrase (x1), and a period (x2) and ties them
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: together to build a complete sentence. Rules also
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can involve phrase re-ordering, as in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: NPB(x0:JJ x1:NN) ↔ x1 x0
column3: page=1 xpos=1 ypos=8 left-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: This rule builds an English noun phrase out of an
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: adjective (x0) and a noun (x1), but in the Chinese,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=1 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: the order is reversed. Multilevel rules can tie several
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: of these concepts together; the rule
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: VP(VBD(was) VP-C(x0:VBN PP(IN(by) x1:NP-C)))
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: ↔ ú x1 x0
column3: page=1 xpos=7 ypos=1 right-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail line-space above-line-space

column2: takes a Chinese word ú and two English con-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: stituents — x1, a noun phrase, and x0, a past-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: participle verb — and translates them into a phrase
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the form “was [verb] by [noun-phrase]”. Notice
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that the order of the constituents has been reversed in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the resulting English phrase, and that English func-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion words have been generated.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The decoder builds up a translation from the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: Chinese sentence into an English tree by apply-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing these rules. It follows the decoding-as-parsing
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: idea exemplified by Wu (1996) and Yamada and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: Knight (2002). For example, the Chinese verb
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: phrase ú ´ 0 â (literally, “[passive] police
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: kill”) can be translated to English via four rules (see
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Table 1).
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail string-table headchar-capital tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3 DerivTool
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In order to test whether good translations can be gen-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: erated with rules learned by Galley et al. (2004),
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: we created DerivTool as an environment for interac-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tively using these rules as a decoder would. A user
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: starts with a Chinese sentence and applies rules one
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: after another, building up a translation from Chinese
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to English. After finishing the translation, the user
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can save the trace of rule-applications (the deriva-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion tree) for later analysis.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We now outline the typical procedure for a user
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: to translate a sentence with DerivTool. To start, the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: user loads a set of sentences to translate and chooses
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a particular one to work with. The tool then presents
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: the user with a window split halfway up. The top
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=-12 single-column centered left-indent right-indent box page-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 1: DerivTool with a completed derivation.
column3: page=2 xpos=2 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-period column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: half is the workspace where the user builds a transla-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion. It initially displays only the Chinese sentence,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: with each word as a separate node. The bottom half
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: presents a set of tabbed panels which allow the user
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to select rules to build up the translation. See Fig-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ure 1 for a picture of the interface showing a com-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pleted derivation tree.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The most immediately useful panel is called Se-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: lecting Template, which shows a grid of possible En-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: glish phrasal translations for Chinese phrases from
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the sentence. This phrase grid contains both phrases
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learned in our extracted rules (e.g., “the police”
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from earlier) and phrases learned by the phrase-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: based translation system (Och and Ney, 2004) <sup>1</sup> . The
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: user presses a grid button to choose a phrase to in-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: clude in the translation. At this point, a frequency-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>1</sup> The phrase-based system serves as a sparring partner. We
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: display its best decoding in the center of the screen. Note that
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified font-smallest hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: in Figure 1 its output lacks an auxiliary verb and an article.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: ordered list of rules will appear; these rules trans-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: late the Chinese phrase into the button-selected En-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: glish phrase, and the user specifies which one to use.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Often there will be more than one rule (e.g., â
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-capital

column2: may translate via the rule VBD(killed) ↔ â or
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line longer-tail headchar-lower

column2: VBN(killed) ↔ â ), and sometimes there are no
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified font-larger aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: rules available. When there are no rules, the buttons
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: are marked in red, telling us that the phrase-based
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system has access to this phrasal translation but our
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learned syntactic rules did not capture it. Other but-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tons are marked green to represent translations from
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the specialized number/name/date system, and oth-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ers are blue, indicating the phrases in the phrase-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: based decoder’s best output. A purple button indi-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cates both red and blue, i.e., the phrase was cho-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sen by the phrase-based decoder but is unavailable
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in our syntactic framework. This is a bad combina-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion, showing us where rule learning is weak. The
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: remaining buttons are gray.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent page-top headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Once the user has chosen the phrasal rules re-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: quired for translating the sentence, the next step is
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: to stitch these phrases together into a complete En-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: glish syntax tree using more general rules. These are
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: found in another panel called Searching. This panel
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: allows a user to select a set of adjacent, top-level
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: nodes in the tree and find a rule that will connect
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: them together. It is commonly used for building up
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: larger constituents from smaller ones. For example,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: if one has a noun-phrase, a verb-phrase, and a pe-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: riod, the user can search for the rule that connects
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: them and builds an “S” on top, completing the sen-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tence. The results of a search are presented in a list,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: again ordered by frequency.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: A few more features to note are: 1) loading and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: saving your work at any point, 2) adding free-form
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: notes to the document (e.g. “I couldn’t find a rule
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that...”), and 3) manually typing rules if one cannot
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be found by the above methods. This allows us to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: see deficiencies in the framework.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4 How DerivTool Helps
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: First, DerivTool has given us confidence that our
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: syntax-based framework can work, and that the rules
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: we are learning are good. We have been able to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: manually build a good translation for each sentence
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: we tried, both for short and long sentences. In fact,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: there are multiple good ways to translate sentences
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: using these rules, because different DerivTool users
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: translate sentences differently. Ordering rules by
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: frequency and/or probability helps us determine if
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the rules we want are also frequent and favored by
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: our model.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: DerivTool has also helped us to find problems
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: with the framework and to see clearly how to fix
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: them. For example, in one of our first sentences
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: we realized that there was no rule for translat-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing a date — likewise for numbers, names, cur-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rency values, and times of day. Our phrase-based
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system solves these problems with a specialized
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: date/name/number translator. Through the process
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of manually typing syntactic transformation rules
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for dates and numbers in DerivTool, it became clear
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that our current date/name/number translator did not
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: provide enough information to create such syntac-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tic rules automatically. This sparked a new area of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=3 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: research before we had a fully-functional decoder.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent column-top headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We also found that multi-word noun phrases, such
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: as “Israeli Prime Minister Sharon” and “the French
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: Ambassador’s visit” were often parsed in a way that
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: did not allow us to learn good translation rules.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The flat structure of the constituents in the syntax
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: tree makes it difficult to learn rules that are general
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: enough to be useful. Phrases with possessives also
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: gave particular difficulty due to the awkward mul-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tilevel structure of the parser’s output. We are re-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: searching solutions to these problems involving re-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: structuring the syntax trees before training.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Finally, our tool has helped us find bugs in our
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: system. We found many cases where rules we
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: wanted to use were unexpectedly absent. We eventu-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ally traced these bugs to our rule extraction system.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Our decoder would have simply worked around this
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: problem, producing less desirable translations, but
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: DerivTool allowed us to quickly spot the missing
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: rules.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5 Conclusion
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We created DerivTool to test our MT framework
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: against real-world data before building a fully-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: functional decoder. By allowing us to play the role
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of a decoder and translate sentences manually, it has
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: given us insight into how well our framework fits
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the data, what some of its weaknesses are, and how
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it compares to other systems. We continue to use
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it as we try out new rule-extraction techniques and
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: finish the decoding system.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space
